text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Atari ST is a series of computers marketed in the late 1980s. It was an affordable computer utilized by consumers (games) and professional creaters (publication and music synthesis). The first model featured a Motorola 68000 CPU at 8MHz, 512KB of RAM and a Yamaha 3-way sound chipset. It could display a resolution of 320x200 in 16 colors or 640x200 in monochrome. ST stands for Sixteen Thirty-two, the two architectures used by the system. It is also said to be the initials of Sam Tramiel, son of Atari's president at the time.
